Bright Harvest Sweet Potato Company

Clarksville, Arkansas



EPA Risk Management Program 

Executive Summary

July 13, 2012



I .Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Bright Harvest Sweet Potato Company complies with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations. Management commitment to safety is foremost and is implemented through numerous policies and procedures. These include policies related to specific regulatory programs; notification and response procedures; emergency action procedures including ammonia release, evacuation, chemical spills, and facility security. Employees are routinely trained in general safety, work place hazards, and handling of hazardous materials. Contractors are informed of company procedures and work place hazards. Bright Harvest is involved with the local LEPC and is current as to emergency support and responsibilities in case of and emergency.



II.Facility and Regulated Substances

Bright Harvest Sweet Potato Company is located and know locally as I-40 exit 58, end of Taylor Road (frontage) and is identified for 911 emergency services as 509 Taylor Road. Raw sweet potatoes are received, washed, peeled, trimmed, cut, cooked, mixed, formed, frozen, and packaged. Anhydrous ammonia, liquefied under pressure is used in a closed loop system for cooling, freezing, and frozen storage. There are approximately 20,000 lbs of ammonia on site. Bright Harvest also complies with applicable environmental regulations to control chemical spills and the possibility of contamination to storm water and or effluent streams.



III.Worst Case and Alternate Case Release Scenarios

Bright Harvest maintains current worst and alternate release scenarios as a component to support emergency response and planning within the site and LEPC. 



IV.General Accidental Release Prevention Program

Bright Harvest Sweet Potato Company complies with OSHA Process Safety Management for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (PSM) standards relative

to anhydrous ammonia. Programs are in place to ensure proper operation and maintenance of the ammonia system; initial and refresher training of operators and maintenance; ensuring the system is designed and maintained to meet industry and engineering standards; and regularly scheduled inspections by qualified external contractors to ensure system integrity. The system includes various detection devices, emergency shutdown devices, and safety relief valves to avert serious over pressurization. An effective preventive maintenance program is in place to ensure proper maintenance activities and schedules. The facility maintains 24 hour security including routine visual checks of the ammonia system during operation and downtime. Emergency contact protocol is in place.



V.Five Year Accident History

There have been no ammonia releases during the past five years that have resulted in an   offsite evacuation or reportable incident.



VI.Emergency Response Program

At this facility the primary emphasis is to safely evacuate all employees in the event of an accidental release, pursuant to the requirements of OSHA 1910.38 (a). Coordination with the local fire department and LEPC is initiated during an emergency situation.



VII.Safety Improvement

Bright Harvest Sweet Potato Company continually monitors its safety activities to ensure it is current with acceptable practices. Improvements may be sourced through outside contractors, inspections, audits, and employee input. Safety training is scheduled at a minimum of annually to ensure employees are informed of current activities and regulatory requirements.
